metadata.title: CVE-2019-9947 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in urllib2 in Python 2.x through 2.7.16 and urllibin Python 3.x through 3.7.3. CRLF injection is possible if the attackercontrols a url parameter, as demonstrated by the first argument tourllib.request.urlopen with \r\n (specifically in the path component of aURL that lacks a ? character) followed by an HTTP header or a Rediscommand. This is similar to the CVE-2019-9740 query string issue. This isfixed in: v2.7.17, v2.7.17rc1, v2.7.18, v2.7.18rc1; v3.5.10, v3.5.10rc1,v3.5.8, v3.5.8rc1, v3.5.8rc2, v3.5.9; v3.6.10, v3.6.10rc1, v3.6.11,v3.6.11rc1, v3.6.12, v3.6.9, v3.6.9rc1; v3.7.4, v3.7.4rc1, v3.7.4rc2,v3.7.5, v3.7.5rc1, v3.7.6, v3.7.6rc1, v3.7.7, v3.7.7rc1, v3.7.8, v3.7.8rc1,v3.7.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-examples - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-venv - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.8-1~18.04.2').
python3.7 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
